chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Rivest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Forfeiture). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in full by 01-08-2016 or suspension of driver's license for up to two years or until paid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Rivest

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nicholas A Rivest in court.  

State moves to amend count 2 to an OAR Civil.
Defedant has no objections.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Count 1 is dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $330.50
To be paid in full by:  01/08/16
Alternate:  D.L. Suspension.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nicholas A Rivest in court.   
Case called along with:  15CM843
Court vacates the stayed warrant.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas A Rivest not in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called at 10:38 a.m. 
Court issued capias, but stays it until next court date. If defendant fails to appear, warrant will be issued and bail will be fofeited.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Nicholas A Rivest in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorne  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
